title: Route & Time Planner
description: Plan route duration, fuel stops, and trip costs for driving, cycling, hiking, and motorcycle trips. Calculate ETA with breaks, fuel needs, and travel expenses in one comprehensive tool.

sections.title: What This Tool Does
content: Route Time Calculator: Estimate moving time and total ETA including breaks for any mode of travel—driving, cycling, hiking, or motorcycle.
Fuel Planner: Calculate fuel needs and costs for driving and motorcycle trips. Get fuel stop recommendations for long rides.
Pace Calculator: For cyclists and hikers, calculate time based on pace per kilometer with break time included.
Range Planner: For motorcyclists, estimate safe range based on tank size, fuel efficiency, and reserve requirements.

sections.title: When to Use This Tool
content: Road Trip Planning: Calculate driving time, fuel costs, and toll expenses for car trips. Budget for the full journey including breaks.
Motorcycle Adventures: Plan fuel stops based on your bike's range. Ensure you never run low on remote stretches.
Cycling Events: Estimate finish time based on your pace. Plan rest stops and food breaks for century rides.
Hiking Trips: Calculate hiking time based on distance and pace. Plan rest breaks and know when you'll reach camp.
Delivery Planning: Estimate arrival times for deliveries. Calculate fuel costs for expense reporting.

sections.title: How to Use
content: Step 1: Select your travel mode (Driving, Cycling, Hiking, or Motorcycle).
Step 2: Enter the total distance in kilometers.
Step 3: Input your average speed (km/h) or pace (min/km for cycling/hiking).
Step 4: Add planned break time in minutes.
Step 5 (optional): For driving/motorcycle: enter fuel efficiency, fuel price, and toll costs.
Step 6 (motorcycle only): Enter tank size and reserve percentage for fuel stop planning.
Step 7: Review results: moving time, total ETA, fuel needs, and cost estimates.

sections.title: Default Speeds by Mode
content: Driving: 80 km/h average (highway and city mixed)
Cycling: 20 km/h average (recreational pace)
Hiking: 5 km/h average (moderate terrain)
Motorcycle: 60 km/h average (touring pace)
Adjust these based on your specific conditions—mountain roads, traffic, fitness level, or weather.

sections.title: Fuel Stop Planning for Motorcycles
content: Safe Range: Calculated as tank size × fuel efficiency × (1 - reserve%). This is your maximum range before hitting reserve.
Stop Interval: Recommended to refuel at 80% of safe range for safety margin. Never plan to run to empty.
Example: 18L tank, 20 km/L efficiency, 12% reserve = 317 km safe range. Stop every 254 km.
For remote areas, reduce stop interval to 60-70% of safe range for extra safety.

sections.title: Tips for Accurate Estimates
content: ✓ Adjust for Conditions: Reduce speed estimates for mountain roads, traffic, poor weather, or heavy loads.
✓ Include All Breaks: Add time for fuel stops, food breaks, rest stops, and sightseeing. Plan 10-15 min every 2 hours.
✓ Buffer Time: Add 10-20% buffer for unexpected delays—construction, wrong turns, or extended breaks.
✓ Fuel Efficiency Varies: Highway driving gets better mileage than city. Motorcycles vary greatly with riding style.
✓ Check Real Data: Use past trip data or apps to refine your speed and fuel efficiency estimates.

sections.title: Pace Calculation for Cyclists and Hikers
content: Cycling Pace: Recreational cyclists average 15-25 km/h (2:24-4:00 min/km). Road cyclists may average 30+ km/h.
Hiking Pace: Flat trails: 4-6 km/h. Moderate hills: 3-4 km/h. Steep terrain: 2-3 km/h.
Break Planning: Plan 5-10 min breaks every hour for cycling, 10-15 min every 1-2 hours for hiking.
Elevation Matters: Add 1 minute per 10 meters of elevation gain for hiking pace estimates.

sections.title: Example Calculations
content: Road Trip: 420 km at 80 km/h, 40 min breaks, 16 km/L, $1.50/L fuel, $12 tolls = 5.25 h driving, 5.9 h total, 26.3 L fuel, $51.45 total cost.
Motorcycle Ride: 640 km, 18L tank, 20 km/L, 12% reserve = 317 km safe range, stop every 254 km, 2 fuel stops needed.
Cycling Century: 160 km at 20 km/h (3:00 min/km), 60 min breaks = 8 h riding, 9 h total ETA.
Hiking Trip: 24 km at 5 km/h (12:00 min/km), 35 min breaks = 4.8 h hiking, 5.4 h total.
